name: David Hasselhoff Lyrics Quiz III: The Reckoning | Music | 20 Questions

questions.text: "I've been looking for freedom since I left __________."
questions.explanation:
my home town.

	David's been looking for freedom since he left his home town, and I hope he finds it.  Just like David's musical career, this quiz starts with the 1989 hit, "Looking for Freedom."

questions.text: "Wir zwei allein heut nacht, hey was _______ du."
questions.explanation:
glaubst.

	Don't ask me what it means, 'cause I don't know.  From the wonderful Gwen duet, "Wir Zwei Allein."

questions.text: "I (I) will write 'I love you' in the ____."
questions.explanation:
sand.

	"Crazy For You" is a great song from David's second album, "Crazy For You," which came out in 1990.  If you're not crazy about David, then you must be crazy.

questions.text: Okay, calm down, here's an easy one: "We'll build a castle out of honesty, fill every room with the _______."
questions.explanation:
harmony.

	This is, perhaps, my favorite lyric, from "Flying on the Wings of Tenderness."  I wonder what a castle built out of honesty looks like.

questions.text: "We can limbo in the sand to a _____________."
questions.explanation:
steel drum band.

	"Do the Limbo Dance" is a great party song from the 1994 album, "David."

questions.text: "In her ___ ferrari with the top pulled down."
questions.explanation:
red.

	David seems really turned on by the fact that she's driving a red ferrari, and she's wearing skin tight jeans.  I wonder who "she" is?  I guess we'll never know, which is why David's such an enigma.

questions.text: "Daddy, why do children ___?"
questions.explanation:
cry.

	This is from the song "Save the World" and is actually spoken by Taylor-Ann.  I don't know who Taylor-Ann is.

questions.text: "Sometimes you just do ______ you don't mean to."
questions.explanation:
things.

	"These Lovin' Eyes" is a beautiful, slow song from the 1994 album, "Du."  Oh, how I wish I got the chance to look into David's lovin' eyes!

questions.text: "__ bist alles, was ich habe auf der Welt."
questions.explanation:
Du.

	"Du" is the title track from my favorite album, "Du."  It means "you" in German.

questions.text: "But my simple fate is at the ____, and girl you've got the key."
questions.explanation:
gate.

	"Fallin' in Love" was released as a single in 1995.  Someday, I hope to have the key to David's gate.

questions.text: "If your problems are caused by _________, come and join us, you'll forget your ___________."
questions.explanation:
heartbreak, heartache.

	"Is Everybody Happy" from the debut album, 1989's "Looking for Freedom."  I hope my quiz is making you happy.  I like making people happy.

questions.text: "Try to see the _____ from the other side."
questions.explanation:
thing.

	David's lyricist is really skilled at using the word "thing," (see Question 8). "The Best is Yet to Come" is from my second favorite album, 1993's "You are Everything."  It cheers me up every time!

questions.text: "Look at the _______, the faces of _______."
questions.explanation:
madness, sadness.

	"Freedom for the World" is from the 1989 debut album, "Looking for Freedom."  I guess freedom is a popular theme with David.

questions.text: "Springtime in _____, it was late in the night."
questions.explanation:
Paris.

	"Je T'Aime Means I Love You" is a song about David trying to pick up a girl who only speaks French.  Too bad David only speaks anglais.  Just kidding, I'm sure he can get any woman he wants.  He just has to sidle up to her and say, "Hey, baby. Care to try a little Hasselhoff?"

questions.text: "Watching the intended ________ slowly fade away."
questions.explanation:
realities.

	"Do You Believe in Love" is from 1995, on his only U.S. album, the name of which I can't find anywhere.  Remember when McDonald's had those commercials and they would play the song, "Do You Believe in Magic?"  I bet they would be doing better if they played some David Hasselhoff.

questions.text: "Dim the light, lips like ____."
questions.explanation:
wine.

	"Dance Dance D'Amour" translated roughly means "Dance Dance of Love."  David should not be kissing anyone who has lips like wine, since he has been to a rehab center for alcoholism.  WAIT A MINUTE!  I wonder if this song is a veiled metaphor for his battle with alcoholism?  Wow, that would be pretty clever.  I wouldn't put it past him.

questions.text: "What a feeling, to sing for _______ around the world!"
questions.explanation:
freedom.

	"Everybody Sunshine" is an interesting song because the title makes no sense.

questions.text: "I believe, there is a ________, I believe, we must climb."
questions.explanation:
mountain.

	"I Believe" is David's Baywatch duet with Laura Branigan.  He says we must climb a mountain.  I hope that's a metaphor, because I'm afraid of heights.

questions.text: True or False: "Freedom for You and Me" is a David Hasselhoff song.
questions.explanation:
False.

	There is no song called "Freedom for You and Me" by David Hasselhoff . . . although I think he should consider making it.

questions.text: What is the most commonly used word in David Hasselhoff's songs?
questions.explanation:
freedom.

	Freedom is far and away the most commonly used word in David's songs.  It is used in "Looking for Freedom," "Flying on the Wings of Tenderness," "Save the World," "Is Everybody Happy," "Freedom for the World," and "Everybody Sunshine." I hope you've enjoyed exploring the world of David Hasselhoff's songs with me.  I know I have.  And I've learned a lot also, such as: David Hasselhoff really cares about freedom.
